abstract: Angelo R. Mozilo will voluntarily give up $37.5 million in severance and consulting pay in connection with the proposed takeover by the Bank of America Corporation.

lead_paragraph: The chief executive of the Countrywide Financial Corporation, Angelo R. Mozilo, will voluntarily give up $37.5 million in severance and consulting pay in connection with the proposed takeover by the Bank of America Corporation.

headline.main: Countrywide Chief Forgoes $37.5 Million in Exit Pay

abstract: The fear of potential regulatory crackdowns helped drive Countrywide Financial into the arms of acquirer Bank of America, according to The Wall Street Journal.
